paramInformation.label: Motion Clear Delay
paramInformation.description: How long to wait after the last motion detection before reporting no motion

options.label: Motion: 0xFF, no reports for no motion
Motion: 0x00, no reports for no motion
No motion: 0xFF, no reports for motion
No motion: 0x00, no reports for motion

paramInformation.label: Low Battery Threshold
paramInformation.description: Below this level a low battery alert will be sent.

paramInformation.label: Battery Check Interval
paramInformation.description: How often to check the battery level for changes

paramInformation.label: Battery Change Report Threshold
paramInformation.description: How much the battery level must change before sending a new report

paramInformation.label: Temperature Check Interval
paramInformation.description: How often to check the temperature for changes

paramInformation.label: Temperature Change Report Threshold
paramInformation.description: How much the temperature must change before sending a new report

paramInformation.label: Temperature Report Interval
paramInformation.description: The minimum interval in which the sensor will send temperature updates, even if the change threshold is not met.

paramInformation.label: Brightness Check Interval
paramInformation.description: How often to check the brightness for changes

paramInformation.label: Brightness Change Report Threshold
paramInformation.description: How much the brightness must change before sending a new report

paramInformation.label: Brightness Calibration
paramInformation.description: Value is offset by 100: 0 = -100 lux, 50 = -50 lux, 100 = 0 lux, 150 = +50 lux, 200 = +100 lux

paramInformation.label: Brightness Threshold for Motion
paramInformation.description: Motion reports will only be sent while the brightness is below this level

paramInformation.label: Brightness Report Interval
paramInformation.description: The minimum interval in which the sensor will send brightness updates, even if the change threshold is not met.

metadata.inclusion:
Put your Z-Wave® hub into inclusion mode and click
the Z-Wave® button 3 times as quickly as possible. The
LED indicator will start blinking to confirm inclusion
mode and turn off once inclusion is completed
metadata.exclusion:
1. Bring the sensor within direct range of your Z-Wave®
gateway (hub).
2. Put the Z-Wave® hub into exclusion mode (not sure
how to do that? ask@getzooz.com).
3. Click the Z-Wave® button 3 times quickly.
4. Your hub will confirm exclusion and the sensor will
disappear from your controller''s device list
metadata.reset:
When your network’s primary controller is missing or
otherwise inoperable, you may need to reset the device
to factory settings manually. In order to complete the
process, make sure the sensor is powered, then hold
the Z-Wave® button down for at least 10 seconds.
The LED indicator will start flashing blue and turn solid
blue for a couple of seconds to indicate successful reset.
NOTE: All previously recorded activity and custom settings will be
erased from the device’s memory
